summary: The fifth and final season of Netflix’sStranger Thingsis dropping on Netflix just in time for Thanksgiving . The conclusion to its monster hit series will arrive in three batches . The first four episodes are set to debut at 8 p.m. ET on November 26 . The following three will air on Christmas Day at the same time .  Netflix has been breaking up hits likeBridgertoninto two batched binges for years . Hulu sticks with full binge for The Bear, Prime Video offers three episodes to kick off the new season of The Boys before slowing down with weekly episodes .  Netflix set out to monopolize two close-together holidays: Memorial Day and July 4th . The first volume of the fourth season arrived on May 27, 2022, with seven episodes . The season racked up a seismic1.35 billion hours of viewing in its first 28 days .  Netflix is trying to conquer all family holidays with a gargantuan four-quadrant hit . It's an ingenuous tactic for driving up end-of-year subscriptions, one that will almost certainly end up breaking viewership records . Netflix is capitalizing on its captive audience .  The final season of "Stranger Things" will be released in October . Netflix will stream two more Christmas Day NFL games this year . Some fans are not happy with the release date .  If the grand finale succeeds at the level Netflix expects it to, perhaps the end ofStranger Thingswill spell the beginning of a new arms race for holiday streaming content, launching in 2026 .

Netflix reported robust growth with Q1 revenues reaching $10.54 billion, up 12.5% YoY and 54.8% jump in EPS to $6.61 . NFLX has set an ambitious target to double its revenues by 2030 and reach a $1 trillion market capitalization . CEO pay has risen an astronomical 1,085% since 1978, compared to a paltry 24% rise in typical workers’ pay . In 2023, CEOs were paid on average 290 times more than a typical worker, a stark contrast to 1965 .  David Gitlin, CEO of Carrier Global, made $65.73 million last year, up 271% from the year before . Apple CEO Tim Cook took home $74.61 million in 2024, up 18% from 2023 . GE’s chief executive, H. Lawrence Culp Jr., made $88.95 million, up 505% .

Commerce Department reported on Friday that inflation rose only slightly in April, a positive sign for the economy after it contracted in the first quarter of 2025 . President Donald Trump’s tariffs, which were announced in early April, have been put on hold as trade negotiations with several countries are ongoing . Consumer confidence rebounded in May, indicating that people now have more faith in the economy's prospects . Given the positive sentiment, it would be prudent to invest in consumer discretionary stocks such as Interface, Inc.TILE,Kontoor Brands, Inc.,KTB,GDEV Inc.GDEV andNetflix .  Consumer spending slowed in April but still increased 0.2% month over month . Core PCE, which strips out the volatile food and energy components, rose 0.1% sequentially and 2.5% from year-ago levels . Inflation has been showing signs of cooling over the past few months .  Interface’s expected earnings growth rate for the current year is 8.2%. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for current-year earnings has improved by 2.6% over the past 60 days . Evercore ISI raises its price target to $1,350, keeping an Outperform rating . Netflix still holds less than 10% of a $650 billion global entertainment market . Rising margins and free cash flow could pave the way for buybacks or even a dividend .  TD Cowen bumped its target to $1,325, citing growth in ad-tier users . JPMorgan, however, lowered its rating to Neutral, even as it raised the target . Loop Capital stayed cautious and noted rich valuation despite strong content and ad tools . Netflix is bringing Sesame Street to its lineup .
